alert.note: Alert for Putnam; Rockland; Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 4:35PM EDT until July 03 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following counties, Putnam, Rockland and Westchester. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas is expected * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 433 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is to begin shortly in the advisory area as torrential rain from thunderstorms move over the area. - Rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ossining, Peekskill, Haverstraw, Cold Spring, Pomona, Stony Point, Jefferson Valley, Putnam Valley, West Haverstraw, Croton-on-Hudson, Mount Ivy, Thiells and Buchanan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
